result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha L. Sharkus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
-------------------------------------

IT IS ORDERED, pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015, that upon successful completion of the sentence imposed WITH NO VIOLATION OF THE RULES OF PROBATION, the Clerk of Court shall issue an order expunging the record.
-------------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
-------------------------------------

Pay restitution in the amount of $3,442.51 and restitution surcharge.
-------------------------------------
*AMENDMENT 05/25/2016 - Pay additional restitution in the amount of $9,570.38 and restitution surcharge from Juvenile file that was dismissed and read in. Restitution is subject to Defendant's right to challenge within 30 days.
-------------------------------------

Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
-------------------------------------

timeConds.notes: Complete twenty (20) hours of community service work during the period of probation ordered WITHOUT buyout option.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samantha L. Sharkus

defendant.name: Sharkus, Samantha L.
defendant.address: 215 Country Club Dr., #1B, Lake Geneva, WI 53147

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Samantha L. Sharkus in court with attorney Peter Wilson.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
Status conference on April 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

10:17 am  Defendant Samantha L. Sharkus in court with attorney Peter Wilson.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter is on for Motion to Reconsider filed by Attorney Wilson.  Court has reviewed motion as well as response filed by State.
Argument by Attorney Herrmann that reverse waiver statute does not apply to statute under which violation was charged.
Argument by Attorney Wilson.
Argument by Attorney Herrmann that Wis Stats 938.17 (1) applies.
Court reviews statutes and 191 Wis 2d 754 and finds case law to be right on point.
Court denies defense motion under due process.  Court finds it has exclusive jurisdiction applicable to this defendant.
Attorney Herrmann further argues that 970.032 does not apply to 938.17.
Court denies motion for reverse waiver based on statutes that were enumerated as well as Supreme Court rulings.
Attorney Wilson takes objection to Court's ruling and cites State v. Kleser  316 Wis 2d 825.
Court reviews 316 Wis 2d 825.
Final argument by Attorney Herrmann.
Court's ruling stands and order to be submitted by Attorney Wilson.
Bond remains.  Minutes filed.
11:12 am  Court in recess.
  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Samantha L. Sharkus in court with attorney Peter Wilson.  Matthew W. Surridge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.  Minutes filed.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion to Reconsider
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

945 am case called. Appearances made. 
Defendant Samantha L. Sharkus in court with attorney Peter Wilson. ADA Haley Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Court reviews preliminary hearing questionnaire and waiver form with defendant. 
Defendant bound over for trial. 
Information filed. 
Arraignment scheduled. 
948 am court in recess. Defendant Samantha L. Sharkus in court with attorney Haley Jo Johnson.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arraignment scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Samantha L Sharkus present in court with attorney Pete Wilson. Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested. Minutes filed.

Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant Samantha L. Sharkus in court with attorney Pete Wilson.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
